description:
"Base Converter Plus" is an app to freely convert between the numbering system to the decimal, octal, hexadecimal or binary base. The relative value range is between decimal negative -2147483648 and positive 4294967295. Binary numbers are shown in 8, 16 and 32 bits, accordingly in 4 octets, either with or without sign. Single bits or the sign may be inverted just by tapping. Decimal values can be individually entered for each byte or 16-bits word. Entering negative values automatically changes the sign.
Additionally, "Base Converter Plus" displays the first three octets as RGB colour codes and one octet as ANSI character equivalent.

The design of "Base Converter Plus" is inspired by Eric J. Parent's "Base Converter 1.21" for PalmOS. It always served me well when writing programs.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Version changes: 

***** 1.1.0 - Initial release.

***** 1.2.0 - Zoom mode for binary matrix, 16-bit mode, on/off switch for every module.

***** 1.2.5 - EBCDIC module added (greetings from switzerland to reviewer Wayne B.). Module order changed. RGB and ANSI marker also visible in zoom mode.
